adjectives.description: wheelie (comparative wheelier or more wheelie, superlative wheeliest or most wheelie)

entries.meaning: (informal) Alternative spelling of wheely (“having wheels; mounted on wheels”).
(informal) An action or stunt where a bicycle, motorcycle, or other vehicle is ridden for a short period while it is standing only on its rear wheel or wheels.
examples: Jim fell off his bike when he was trying to do a wheelie.

verbs.description: wheelie (third-person singular simple present wheelies, present participle wheelying or wheelieing, simple past and past participle wheelied)

entries.meaning: (intransitive, informal) To ride, or perform the stunt of riding, a vehicle on its rear wheel or wheels.
